intro: Seseli pyrenaeum, commonly known as the Pyrenean seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula and southern France. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive, finely toothed margin. Seseli pyrenaeum is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine zones.
